intro: Hieracium bijugipes, commonly known as the two-winged hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped with rough textures, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium bijugipes is often found in open habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
